title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Sen. Tester, a centrist Democrat, said Biden should nominate Fed Chairman Powell to a second term, the latest volley in an intraparty rift over the future leadership of the central bank.

GameStop narrowed its losses and posted sales growth of roughly 26% for the latest quarter, as the videogame retailer seeks to reset its business.

Boeing's board must face a shareholder lawsuit over the fatal crashes of two 737 MAX jets, according to a Delaware judge's ruling.

U.S. stocks fell, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq retreating 0.1%, 0.2% and 0.6%, respectively.

Saudi Prince al-Waleed agreed to sell half his stake in Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts to co-owner Bill Gates, giving Gates control.

Goldman named Kevin Sneader to help run its operations in Asia, months after he was voted out as the leader of McKinsey.

What's News: Business & Finance
